intro: Zieria smithii var. typica, commonly known as the typical zieria, is a flowering plant native to the wet tropical rainforests of eastern Australia. It is a small shrub characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and is often found in the understorey of rainforest ecosystems. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other aromatic plants such as eucalyptus and tea trees. Zieria smithii var. typica plays a role in supporting local wildlife, particularly insect pollinators and small vertebrates.
